p: Our results are in concert with those of other researchers [ 12– 18, 26, 27]. In the series by Fariña et al. [ 12], there was an 83% diagnostic concordance between MIA-US and CA. Castilho et al. [ 14] reported a success rate of 83% for the determination of cause of death by MIA-US in a study of 30 patients with a predominance of infectious diseases. Recently, Martinez et al. [ 15] compared MIA-US and CA in 30 patients and obtained an 89.5% concordance for the detection of an infectious agent directly involved in the cause of death. Conversely, Cox et al. [ 13] found a 57% concordance between MIA-US and CA for infectious major diagnoses, mainly present in the lungs (63%), liver (44%), and spleen (34%). Result differences among studies possibly relate to different patient populations and different causal mixes.
